claim_reports.claim_text: Fluoride lowers IQs, confirmed by a Harvard study published on July 27, 2012.
claim_reports.verdict_summary: Multiple high-reliability sources, including a Harvard study, consistently indicate that children exposed to higher levels of fluoride tend to have lower IQ scores, strongly supporting the claim that fluoride lowers IQs.

supports.title: [PDF] When considering the risks and benefits of fluoride exposure, the ...
supports.evidence_summary: The evidence indicates that children with higher fluoride exposure tend to perform worse on IQ tests, which aligns with the claim that fluoride lowers IQs.
supports.snippet: On average, children with higher fluoride exposure showed poorer performance on IQ tests. Fluoride released into the ground water in China in some cases greatly.

supports.title: Impact of fluoride on neurological development in children
supports.evidence_summary: The evidence indicates that children in high-fluoride areas had significantly lower IQ scores compared to those in low-fluoride areas, supporting the claim that fluoride can lower IQs.
supports.snippet: Thus, children in high-fluoride areas had significantly lower IQ scores than those who lived in low-fluoride areas. The children studied were up ...

supports.title: Effects of High-Water Fluoride Exposure on IQ Levels in School-Age ...
supports.evidence_summary: The evidence indicates that the group exposed to high levels of fluoride had lower average IQ scores compared to the control group, suggesting a negative impact of fluoride on IQ levels.
supports.snippet: The HF group exhibited lower average IQ scores than the CONTROL group, with a statistically significant difference among the groups (P < 0.001). The proportion ...

supports.title: Developmental fluoride neurotoxicity: a systematic review and meta ...
supports.evidence_summary: The evidence indicates that children in high-fluoride areas had significantly lower IQ scores compared to those in low-fluoride areas, supporting the claim that fluoride is associated with lower IQs.
supports.snippet: Thus, children in high-fluoride areas had significantly lower IQ scores than those who lived in low-fluoride areas. Subgroup and sensitivity analyses also ...

claim_reports.claim_text: Another Harvard study published on July 26, 2012, finds fluoride lowers children's IQ.
claim_reports.verdict_summary: The evidence presents a mixed view on the claim that fluoride lowers children's IQ. While one study indicates a correlation between high fluoride exposure and lower IQ scores (PubMed article), other sources suggest that the claims about fluoride's effects may be misleading and lack reliable support (Harvard study and NTP assessment). This indicates that while some evidence supports the claim, significant skepticism exists regarding the interpretation of the data.

refutes.title: Effects of High-Water Fluoride Exposure on IQ Levels in School-Age ...
refutes.evidence_summary: The evidence discusses a Harvard study that has been misrepresented regarding fluoride's effects on children's IQ, indicating that the claims about fluoride lowering IQ are misleading and not supported by reliable evidence.
refutes.snippet: Excessive exposure to fluorine has severe negative effects on the intellectual development of children. It is necessary to monitor children's urinary fluoride ...

supports.title: Developmental fluoride neurotoxicity: a systematic review and meta ...
supports.evidence_summary: The evidence indicates that children living in high-fluoride areas had significantly lower IQ scores compared to those in low-fluoride areas, supporting the claim that fluoride may lower children's IQ.
supports.snippet: Thus, children in high-fluoride areas had significantly lower IQ scores than those who lived in low-fluoride areas.

mixed.title: Impact of fluoride on neurological development in children
mixed.evidence_summary: The article discusses a Harvard study that has been misrepresented regarding fluoride's impact on children's IQ, indicating that while some studies suggest a correlation, the conclusions drawn by critics may be misleading and lack context.
mixed.snippet: Thus, children in high-fluoride areas had significantly lower IQ scores than those who lived in low-fluoride areas. The children studied were up ...

mixed.title: Fluoride Exposure: Neurodevelopment and Cognition
mixed.evidence_summary: The evidence discusses a meta-analysis that suggests a correlation between fluoride exposure and decreased IQ in children, but it also highlights that the conclusions drawn from the studies are often misrepresented and criticized for their reliability.
mixed.snippet: The meta-analysis found that for every 1 mg/L increase in urinary fluoride, there is a decrease of 1.63 IQ points in children. Using data from the high-quality ...

claim_reports.claim_text: Fluoridation of water causes children's IQs to lower, leading to health problems.
claim_reports.verdict_summary: The evidence from multiple high-reliability sources, including the National Academies and the American Dental Association, consistently indicates that studies suggesting a link between fluoride exposure and lower IQ are flawed and do not support a causal relationship at the levels used in community water fluoridation.

refutes.title: Fluoride Exposure: Neurodevelopment and Cognition
refutes.evidence_summary: The evidence indicates that while some studies have reported associations between fluoride exposure and lower IQ, these findings are not supported by robust research, and many studies show no significant impact of fluoridation on IQ. The National Academies concluded that there is no clear evidence linking fluoride at levels used in water fluoridation to lower IQ.
refutes.snippet: An association indicates a connection between fluoride and lower IQ; it does not prove a cause and effect. Many substances are healthy and beneficial when taken ...

refutes.title: Fluoride and IQ - NPR
refutes.evidence_summary: The evidence indicates that the systematic review claiming fluoride exposure lowers children's IQ is considered deeply flawed, and no connection was found between fluoride intake at recommended levels and lower IQ.
refutes.snippet: They conclude with moderate confidence that there is an association between higher levels of fluoride and lower IQ in children. The report didn' ...

refutes.title: Fluoride Exposure and Children's IQ Scores: A Systematic ... - PubMed
refutes.evidence_summary: The evidence indicates that while some studies suggest a link between fluoride exposure and lower IQ, the American Dental Association (ADA) and experts argue that these studies are flawed and do not support a connection at the levels used in community water fluoridation.
refutes.snippet: Importance: Previous meta-analyses suggest that fluoride exposure is adversely associated with children's IQ scores.

refutes.title: Fluoride Exposure and Children's IQ Scores: A Systematic Review ...
refutes.evidence_summary: The evidence indicates that while some studies suggest a decrease in IQ associated with fluoride exposure, the American Dental Association (ADA) and experts argue that these studies are flawed and do not support a causal link between fluoride levels recommended for community water fluoridation and lower IQs in children.
refutes.snippet: Analysis of 13 studies with individual-level measures found an IQ score decrease of 1.63 points (95% CI, −2.33 to −0.93; P < .001) per 1-mg/L increase in ...

claim_reports.claim_text: A Harvard study from April 5, 2006, shows a link between fluorinated water and bone cancer in boys.
claim_reports.verdict_summary: The evidence presents a mixed stance on the claim. While some sources, including a Harvard study, suggest a potential link between fluoridated water and osteosarcoma in boys, other high-reliability sources refute this by indicating no causal relationship and no significant differences in bone fluoride concentrations between affected individuals and controls.

refutes.title: Is Fluoridated Drinking Water Safe?
refutes.evidence_summary: The evidence discusses a 2006 exploratory analysis that found an increased risk for osteosarcoma in boys exposed to fluoridated water, but ultimately concludes that there is no evidence to support a causal link between fluoridated water and osteosarcoma, as studies showed no difference in bone fluoride concentrations between affected individuals and controls.
refutes.snippet: Scientists linked high levels of naturally occurring fluoride in certain community water supplies to low levels of tooth decay.

refutes.title: Review Article Exposure to fluoride and risk of primary bone cancer
refutes.evidence_summary: The evidence indicates that while an exploratory analysis from 2006 suggested a potential link between fluoridated water and osteosarcoma in boys, subsequent studies, including a case-control study, found no significant difference in bone fluoride concentrations between patients with osteosarcoma and those without, ultimately concluding that there is no evidence to support the claim that fluoridated water causes bone cancer.
refutes.snippet: No clear link between fluoride and primary bone cancers found in 12 of 14 studies. Two studies report a positive link between fluoride and bone cancer in young ...

refutes.title: Water Fluoridation and Cancer Risk - American Cancer Society
refutes.evidence_summary: The evidence indicates that a study co-authored by Dr. Hayes found no significant difference in bone fluoride concentrations between patients with osteosarcoma and those without, suggesting no link between fluoridated water and bone cancer in boys.
refutes.snippet: They concluded, “Overall, no clear association between water fluoridation and incidence or mortality of bone cancers, thyroid cancer, or all ...

supports.title: Age-specific fluoride exposure in drinking water and osteosarcoma ...
supports.evidence_summary: The study found an association between fluoride exposure in drinking water during childhood and the incidence of osteosarcoma among males, particularly noting a significant odds ratio at age 7.
supports.snippet: Our exploratory analysis found an association between fluoride exposure in drinking water during childhood and the incidence of osteosarcoma among males.

supports.title: Did Harvard study downplay risk of fluoride? - NBC News
supports.evidence_summary: The article discusses a Harvard study that indicates a potential link between fluoridated water and an increased risk of osteosarcoma in boys, particularly highlighting Elise Bassin's findings that boys exposed to fluoride at or above target levels had a higher risk of developing the bone cancer.
supports.snippet: “She found the strongest association ever between fluoridated tap water and bone cancer among boys,” Wiles said. Safety of fluoridated water ...

claim_reports.claim_text: In Austin, Texas, residents have white spots on their teeth due to natural fluoridation.
claim_reports.verdict_summary: Multiple high-reliability sources confirm that excessive fluoride levels in drinking water can lead to dental fluorosis, which manifests as white spots on teeth. This supports the claim regarding residents in Austin experiencing these dental issues due to natural fluoridation.

supports.title: Water Quality Reports | AustinTexas.gov
supports.evidence_summary: The evidence discusses the effects of high fluoride levels in drinking water, specifically mentioning that excessive fluoride can lead to dental fluorosis, which causes white spots or stains on teeth. This supports the claim that residents in areas with high natural fluoridation may experience these dental issues.
supports.snippet: In 1945, municipalities began adding fluoride to drinking water to fight tooth decay. ... white markings or streaks may appear on the teeth. If you're concerned ...

supports.title: Austin resident says fluoride compound added to local water supply ...
supports.evidence_summary: The article discusses the effects of high fluoride levels in drinking water, specifically mentioning that excess fluoride can lead to dental fluorosis, which manifests as white or brown stains on teeth. This supports the claim that residents in areas with natural fluoridation, like Austin, may experience white spots on their teeth due to fluoride exposure.
supports.snippet: Dental fluorosis in the United States appears mostly in the very mild or mild form – as barely visible lacy white markings or spots on the ...

supports.title: Unstable Element - The Austin Chronicle
supports.evidence_summary: The evidence discusses the effects of high fluoride levels in drinking water, specifically mentioning that excess fluoride can lead to fluorosis, which causes white or brown stains on developing teeth. This supports the claim that residents in areas with natural fluoridation, like Austin, may experience white spots on their teeth due to fluoride exposure.
supports.snippet: The iconic fluoride image is teeth bearing a distinctive, dappled brown stain, a sign of those exposed to high levels in childhood. Known as the ...

unclear.snippet: Water that is fluoridated at a level optimal for oral health (as is used in Austin) poses no known health risks for infants.

transcript_data.text: hi everyone this is monty i've been doing some investigation into the floor nation of our uh water here in lebanon oregon and i got a letter from the harvard university they posted in the federal government's journal confirms that fluoride lowers iqs and that was on july 27 2012. you can you can most likely find it in uh just by typing in but you can see it's a major harvard university study that confirms that the fluorination of our city water lowers our children's iq now you would think that that would cause writing in the streets demanding that we would have fluoride removed from our water but ironically it doesn't another study this one done by harvard university on july 26th that says it was published in the national institute of health journal finds that fluoride lowers children's iq that's the florida nation of your city water and this is the article right here again it's a harvard university study now both of those were done in this year and you would think that as soon as the american people found out for sure through harvard university after they've done extensive studies that the fluoridation of our water supply causes our children redox retardation making our children's iqs lower causing problems and and families and health you think that people would uh be freaking out and getting the flu right out you think we wouldn't even have to ask our governments and our townships to remove the fluoride fluoride from our water they don't do it you have to fight tooth and now and chances are they're sterile aren't going to do it but if you're not worried about lowering iqs you know everybody says oh my kid's stupid you know we're used to hearing it but here's another release published in april 5th 2006 another one from harvard university studies shows a link between fluorinated water and bone cancer in boys so you know it just goes on and on it's just link after link all of these studies from harvard university uh not to mention the 3600 000 other studies that have been done by numerous people that just plagues this whole fluoridation of water and that people aren't doing anything about it they're not stopping it why is this being put in our water when it is causing the iqs of our children to be lowered causing uh all kinds of problems now here's a great thing me and my girl went to see her obgyn the other day and she had some work done on her while i was in the office i was talking to this specialist with women and children this lady is a doctor who specializes in child rearing and and women issues and stuff and i asked her what she knew about fluoride and she said that she strongly recommends that babies be fed special water that has been specially more foreign more fluorination put in the baby's water for the use of their uh for for their feedings and i asked her if she looked into it she said she felt some concerns about the recent stories of uh you know how fluoride is linked in in brain damage and she she said she hadn't really looked into it too much and i said well i just got you know i told her the story i just got this information on july 26 27th that uh from harvard saying that they definitely have confirmed it does lower uh children's iq and she said for years she'd been telling mothers of newborn babies to buy fluorinated water to feed their babies to put in their babies bottles so that their baby's teeth would be better and stronger well here's an interesting note the nurse that was helping this doctor says hey wait a minute uh i come from austin texas and they have natural fluorination of the water there where the water is over fluorinated and everybody in the town all the town of 300 000 people have white pitted stuff on their teeth and uh she said and everybody in the town acts literally like a bunch of dumbasses those are her words not mine she said that it's just a bunch of hooligans and everybody's kind of hillbilly mentality real low iq individuals and of course their waters naturally overflowed fluorinated it's called uh fluorination opmosis or something like that when you have too much fluorine in your body you get uh white spots on your teeth now here's just a thought if you know anybody with white spots on their teeth ask them a couple of simple questions and see if they're a dumbass because from what i hear from this nurse the people over in austin texas or somewhere around that uh all live in a town where the water has too much fluorine in it naturally and they're all a bunch of dumbasses uh hicks you know she this is her words not mine i i don't know i live in lebanon oregon and uh at any rate get sidetracked here there's all these studies out there saying that uh people who generally are angry and have gang-related problems and are fighting and are criminals usually have lower iqs people who are afraid when you become afraid your iq automatically goes down you lose a couple of points when you get really scared also when you get really angry you lose a couple of points you know it's briefly that's why people who get angry do stupid things what happens when you feed a baby from birth fluorinated water and they drink it their whole life haven't you noticed lately that our kids in america or just slightly not normal i have and i'm only 46 years old and i've noticed a huge decline in intelligence in our kids and i believe the world steady on children's iqs america's kids come in way under the mark like a hundred in the world our children that are being fed by by our country fluoride have the lowest iqs in in the world i mean there's a few countries that are lower in ours but i'm not even really sure there's anybody living there anyway these are just my views and they're backed with you know facts and i did talk to an ogbyn who said that she was recommending that babies drink specially high fluorinated water babies teeth fall out and they get new ones wouldn't it make more sense to wait until they were older to drink fluorinated water however fluoride isn't something that's brought in through the body system through digestion it's a topical thing if you go to a dentist the dentist puts it in a cup and sticks it on your teeth it's because it's absorbed through the teeth it's not absorbed through the body by drinking it and what what parts of it is is absorbed through it would require large amounts for it to do anything your teeth uh hence austin texas and then getting the white spots on their teeth look this stuff up it's on the internet i would like everybody to go and stop the fluorination of water and i think that we need to investigate how this stuff got put in and what is behind it now some people say well monty you're just a conspiracy theorist well that may very well be true but at least if i'm a conspiracy theorist then these people over in the harvard university need to be tarred and feathered because they're saying the same thing i am fluoride makes our children a bunch of retards anyways if you have any thoughts about this feel free to uh drop me a message also you know share this information and hit like on there and also uh subscribe thank you have a good day
